items.name: ICS Power Grid Defense Lab
items.description:
ICS/SCADA defensive training environment for network security operations teams.
Simulates an electric power grid with full Purdue Model segmentation (L0-L5).

Trains defenders to detect and respond to a full IT-to-OT kill chain attack
targeting industrial control systems managing power generation, transmission,
and distribution infrastructure.

Purdue Model Network Zones:
- L5 Internet: External attacker simulation
- L4 Enterprise: Corporate IT (DC, email, engineer workstation)
- L3.5 IT/OT DMZ: Jump host, historian mirror, data diode
- L3 Operations: Site historian, OT engineering workstation
- L2 Supervisory: HMI consoles, SCADA displays
- L1/L0 Process Control: PLCs, RTUs, field devices
- SOC: IDS/SIEM sensors with monitor-mode on OT zones

Industrial Protocols:
- Modbus TCP (PLCs: Substation B breaker, Load management)
- DNP3 (PLCs: Substation A protection relay, Distribution RTU)
- EtherNet/IP / CIP (PLC: Turbine governor)
- OPC UA (PLC: Safety instrumented system, OPC gateway)

Defensive Capabilities:
- IDS sensor with monitor-mode interfaces on IT/OT DMZ, Supervisory, and Process Control networks
- Network monitoring tools (tcpdump, tshark, nmap) on SOC workstations
- Process data historian with REST API for PLC data verification
- HMI web dashboards for real-time process monitoring
- Traffic mirroring on IT/OT DMZ, Supervisory, and Process Control networks
- Full PCAP capture on all mirrored zones
- Detection scoring with MITRE ATT&CK for ICS mapping
- IOC submission and grading
- Threat hunting and forensic analysis workflows

Red Team (Automated Injects - Full Kill Chain):
- IT reconnaissance and spearphishing
- Active Directory credential harvesting
- IT-to-OT pivot via jump host
- OT protocol scanning and enumeration
- HMI screen manipulation
- PLC register/setpoint modification
- Safety system bypass attempt

items.name: Red Team Training Lab
items.description:
Comprehensive red team training environment featuring:
- Kali Attack Box with pre-installed tools (Metasploit, Impacket, CrackMapExec, etc.)
- WordPress target with SQL injection vulnerabilities
- Samba Domain Controller
- Internal file server with sensitive data
- Victim workstation for BeEF exploitation
- C2 redirectors for infrastructure training

Attack paths: SQLi -> Credential theft -> Lateral movement -> Domain compromise

items.name: Red Team Training Lab v2
items.description:
Comprehensive red team training environment featuring:
- Kali Attack Box with pre-installed tools (Metasploit, Impacket, CrackMapExec, etc.)
- WordPress target with SQL injection vulnerabilities
- Samba Domain Controller
- Internal file server with sensitive data
- Victim workstation for BeEF exploitation
- C2 redirectors for infrastructure training

Attack paths: SQLi -> Credential theft -> Lateral movement -> Domain compromise

items.name: Red Team Training Lab v3
items.description:
Advanced red team training environment with realistic network segmentation.
Unlike v2, students must pivot through compromised hosts - no shortcuts!

Key Features:
- Realistic firewall/routing between network segments
- Multiple attack paths (SQLi, Jenkins RCE, VPN credential stuffing)
- SSH tunneling and proxychains required for lateral movement
- Enterprise services (wiki, ticketing, VPN) for added realism

Network Segments:
- Internet: Attacker position, sees only firewall NAT'd services
- DMZ: Web services, jump box, CI/CD
- Internal: Domain infrastructure, sensitive data

Primary Attack Path:
SQLi → SSH pivot → DMZ exploration → Internal access → Domain compromise

items.name: Watering Hole Attack
items.description:
Watering hole attack training scenario featuring:
- Windows 11 victim client on the user network
- Compromised weather website (nginx + Express) serving Sliver implants
- Hidden Sliver C2 server on an isolated subnet
- Dual-homed weather server bridging user and C2 networks

The weather server proxies C2 callbacks (/api/news/) to the hidden Sliver
server. The Windows client has no direct route to the C2 network, mimicking
real-world watering hole infrastructure.

Attack flow: Browse weather site → Click ad → Download implant → C2 callback

items.name: Watering Hole Attack Amazing
items.description:
Demonstrates client-side exploitation via a watering hole attack.
A victim Windows 11 workstation browses to a compromised weather website
(sliver-weather), downloads a trojanized application containing a Sliver C2
implant, which calls back to the listening post. A blue-space Ubuntu operator
machine manages the C2 sessions.

Purpose: Train IT staff on how client exploitation works.

Attack Flow:
1. Victim browses to weather website (watering hole)
2. Downloads trojanized "AtmosVision Pro" installer
3. Implant executes and calls back to Sliver C2 listening post
4. Operator manages C2 sessions from blue-space Ubuntu desktop

Network Segments:
- User Space: Corporate victim workstation
- DMZ: Watering hole website / C2 listening post
- Blue Space: C2 operator console (isolated management network)

VMs:
- Windows 11 Pro x86_64 (victim workstation)
- Sliver-Weather all-in-one (nginx + weather app + Sliver C2)
- Ubuntu KasmVNC Desktop (C2 operator with Sliver client)

items.name: APT Intrusion
items.description:
Simulates an Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) intrusion from initial
spearphishing through to data exfiltration. Covers the full kill chain
including C2 establishment, Active Directory reconnaissance, privilege
escalation, and data staging.

items.name: Incident Response Drill
items.description:
Blue team exercise that plants indicators of compromise across systems.
Participants must identify and document all planted artifacts within
the time limit. Tests detection capabilities and IR procedures.

items.name: Insider Threat
items.description:
Simulates a malicious insider scenario where an employee with legitimate
access exfiltrates sensitive data. Covers after-hours access, unauthorized
data access, data staging, and exfiltration attempts.

items.name: Ransomware Attack
items.description:
Simulates a ransomware attack starting from initial phishing payload
through to file encryption and ransom note deployment. Covers initial
access, persistence, discovery, credential access, lateral movement,
and impact phases of the MITRE ATT&CK framework.

items.name: C2 Operator Console
items.description:
Ubuntu KasmVNC desktop pre-configured for C2 operations.
Includes the Sliver client, network analysis tools, and a
desktop quickstart guide for connecting to a Sliver C2 server.

Pre-installed tools:
- Sliver client (for C2 session management)
- nmap, tcpdump, tshark, Wireshark
- curl, wget, dnsutils, whois
- Python 3, SSH client

Use with the sliver-weather listening post image.

items.name: ICS OT Engineering Workstation
items.description:
OT engineering workstation with KasmVNC desktop and ICS-specific tools.
Includes Modbus/OPC UA/EtherNet-IP clients, Wireshark with ICS dissectors,
Nmap with ICS scripts, and Python ICS libraries for PLC interaction.

items.name: ICS Process Historian
items.description:
Process data historian that polls all PLCs and stores time-series data.
Provides a web interface for viewing historical trends and a REST API
for querying process data. Uses SQLite for lightweight storage.

items.name: ICS SCADA HMI
items.description:
Web-based SCADA HMI dashboard for power grid monitoring.
Polls PLCs via Modbus TCP, OPC UA, or EtherNet/IP and renders
real-time process values with gauges, indicators, and trend charts.
Configurable for substation, generation, or grid overview roles.

items.name: ICS OT Zone Firewall
items.description:
OT perimeter firewall enforcing Purdue Model zone segmentation.
Allows ICS protocols (Modbus TCP 502, OPC UA 4840, EtherNet/IP 44818)
only between authorized pairs (HMI->PLC, historian->PLC).
Blocks all unauthorized cross-zone traffic.

items.name: ICS PLC Simulator
items.description:
Universal ICS PLC simulator for cyber range training.
Supports Modbus TCP (port 502), OPC UA (port 4840), and EtherNet/IP (port 44818).
Protocol and register map configured via environment variables.
Simulates realistic power grid process values with drift and noise.

items.name: Kali Attack Box
items.description: Lightweight Kali Linux attack platform with pre-installed penetration testing tools (Impacket, NetExec, Hydra, etc.)

items.name: redteam-firewall
items.description:
Multi-homed firewall/router for Red Team Training Lab v3.
Provides NAT and access control between network segments.

items.name: redteam-ftp
items.description:
FTP server for Red Team Training Lab v3.
Anonymous access with sensitive files and weak credentials.

items.name: redteam-jenkins
items.description:
Vulnerable Jenkins for Red Team Training Lab v3.
Script Console enabled with weak admin credentials.

items.name: redteam-jumpbox
items.description:
Bastion/jump host for Red Team Training Lab v3.
SSH gateway to internal network with forwarding enabled.

items.name: SMB File Server
items.description: Samba file server with planted sensitive data (employee SSNs, passwords, trade secrets) for lateral movement training.

items.name: Vulnerable WordPress Server
items.description: WordPress with intentionally vulnerable employee portal plugin featuring SQL injection and XSS vulnerabilities.

items.name: Victim Workstation
items.description: Simulated employee workstation with automated browsing behavior for BeEF hook triggering and XSS exploitation training.

items.name: redteam-mysql
items.description:
MySQL database for Red Team Training Lab v3.
Contains sensitive data with weak root credentials.

items.name: redteam-ticketing
items.description:
IT Ticketing system for Red Team Training Lab v3.
Tickets expose internal processes and credentials.

items.name: redteam-vpn
items.description:
OpenVPN gateway for Red Team Training Lab v3.
Dual-homed, accepts credentials found via SQLi.

items.name: redteam-wiki
items.description:
Internal DokuWiki for Red Team Training Lab v3.
Contains sensitive documentation including credentials.

items.name: Samba Active Directory Domain Controller
items.description: Ubuntu-based Samba AD DC with DNS, LDAP, and user provisioning. ARM-compatible alternative to Windows AD.

items.name: Sliver Weather Listening Post
items.description:
All-in-one watering hole website and Sliver C2 listening post.
Bundles nginx, a React weather app, and the Sliver C2 server
into a single container using supervisord.

Services:
- Nginx reverse proxy (ports 80/443)
- Weather app with trojanized download link (port 3001 internal)
- Sliver C2 server (mTLS 31337, operator gRPC 31338)

Clones https://github.com/jongodb/sliver-weather at build time.
Generates a self-signed TLS cert and Sliver operator config on first boot.

items.name: WH C2 Server (Sliver)
items.description: Sliver C2 server for the watering hole attack training scenario. Includes Sliver framework, Docker, mingw-w64 for cross-compilation, and the sliver-weather repo for implant build workflows.

items.name: WH Weather Server
items.description: Watering hole weather frontend with nginx reverse proxy. Dual-homed container that serves a legitimate-looking weather application and proxies C2 callbacks (/api/news/) to a hidden Sliver server on a separate subnet. Includes Node.js, Express, nginx, and Docker.

Suitable for Active Directory, file servers, and legacy Windows server workloads.

items.name: Ubuntu Server 24.04

Suitable for web servers, API servers, and general Linux workloads.

items.name: Ubuntu Desktop 22.04
items.description:
Ubuntu Desktop 22.04 LTS with GNOME desktop environment.
Suitable for user workstations and graphical applications.

items.name: Kali Desktop
items.description:
Kali Linux with full desktop environment and penetration testing tools.
Ideal for red team exercises and security training.

items.name: Kali Attack Box
items.description:
Kali Linux configured as an attack platform with common tools pre-installed.
Uses KasmVNC for fast, native container-based desktop access.
Optimized for red team operations and penetration testing scenarios.
